reviewText: In the same way that the NKJV was done, the NLT decides to do the same thing. It's like listening to a Jay Ward cartoon. There were times during sad parts that because of the hammed up voice I was LOL&ROTF. It would have been better if Johnson would have just read it straight without other actors, or sound effects.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Gregory J. Casteel "Dr. Gregory J. Casteel"
reviewText: A Bible on DVD is a great idea.  You get the best of both worlds: an audio Bible read by a professional orator, PLUS on-screen text so you can easily read along.Unfortunately, this particular DVD Bible leaves much to be desired.  First, there's the translation itself:  The New Living Translation is adequate; but there are much better contemporary English translations out there.  Second, there are the voices:  Though the main narrator does a good job; the cast of actors who read the dialogue have annoying voices that quickly get on your nerves; and they tend to "overact" their parts.  Third, there's the background music and sound effects:  They are distracting, and don't contribute much to one's appreciation of the text.  (Plus, the same music is played over and over again; so it gets old pretty  quick.)  Fourth, there are lots of typos in the on-screen text; the narrator occasionally skips over or misreads words; and the on-screen text doesn't always sync up with the narration (sometimes the narrator gets ahead of the on-screen text; and sometimes the on-screen text gets ahead of the narrator).  Fifth, there's the navigation:  You can go to the start of a specific chapter; but not to a specific verse.  And you can't rewind or fast forward -- you can only skip back or forward by chapters.All in all, this is not a good DVD Bible.  I hope I can find a better one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok. I get up in the morning and sit back in the comfy chair with a cup of joe and read the Bible from the big TV while it is being read to me. There are two DVD's, not one. Disc 1 is the old; disc 2 is the new. You can control the book and chapter with your remote control, stop, pause, or do whatever your dvd player allows. The tv screen looks like a book that is open, two pages at a time. The music is the back ground is very understated and the voice of the readers are lovely. Makes reading the Bible really easy for the busy and weary. WOW>
Title: N/A

reviewText: Got this so my dad could play in on my moms tv in her nursing home room.  She needed the distraction and with the words on the screen are great.  They turn the volume down sometimes and play music.  She turns to the tv and sees the words and will mumble them to herself.  Mission accomplished........
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have checked both my NIV bible and a commentary with NIV readings, and this DVD is NOT accurate, nor as accurate as any other version I have checked it against (I have 2 sets of multiple computer comparision bible software - about 10 versions total).I like to use either my NIV Bible or another version along with this one to get a more accurate version of what is being read.However, that said - I really like the multi-voices and the main reader - Johnson, is very clear; though definitely fast. I have found it much better to just listen rather then try to read along with him. Since I want to try reading the Bible in 40 days, his pace will certainly help out.It does have background noises and music at times - though fortunately not constantly. While I don't care much for the background since I prefer voice only - I still really enjoy listening to this dvd and find it enjoyable to listen to. His voice is clear and easy to listen to.
summary: Fast paced and not exactly NIV

reviewText: The only problem I have with this is that the narrator reads kinda fast so if you don't want to miss anything it might be better to read it for yourself. Otherwise it's nice to pop this in when my eyes are to tired to read. 4 stars.
